children.html:
"Live for Now Moments Anthem" A.K.A. "kendall jenner pepsi commercial", is a Pepsi ad that was removed
        shortly after its release. It depicts Pepsi as a young / cool brand for a self-expressive, young, urban hipster class,
        and represents a blatant attempt at co-opting themes of creativity, inclusivity, diversity, openness to difference ... 
        so dear to the millennial generation. It looks like a parody of a millennial-targeted ad, except it was real.

The advertisement was pulled by the company one day after its distribution due to criticism. The company released a statement, saying:

"Pepsi was trying to project a global message of unity, peace and understanding. Clearly we missed the mark, and we apologize. We did not intend to make light of any serious issue. We are removing the content and halting any further rollout. We also apologize for putting Kendall Jenner in this position."

The advertisement's creators have been widely criticized on social media and by media outlets for attempting to capitalize on imagery imitating protests in the Black Lives Matter movement
